MAN.TITLE: xs2ps
MAN.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: send graphics to a file in PS syntax

PARAM_DESCRIPTION.SP: : optional integer. 0 means black and white and 1 means color. The default value is to use a value compatible with the screen status.

DESCRIPTION.P: xs2ps sends the recorded graphics of the window win_num in the file filen in PS syntax. Warning: filen must not have extension.
This function works only if the selected driver is "Rec" in the window win_num or if the window is in "new style". The generated postscript file does not contrains the header part

MAN.EXAMPLE:
scf(0) plot2d() // Postcript export filename='foo'; // ! no extension xs2ps(0,filename) //add the Postscript file header and create <filename>.eps file if MSDOS then unix_s(pathconvert('""'+WSCI+'/bin/BEpsf'+'""',%f)+' -p ' +filename) else unix_s(pathconvert('SCI/bin/BEpsf',%f)+' -p ' +filename) end
// Gif export xs2gif(0,'foo.gif') // ppm export xs2ppm(0,'foo.ppm')
